explanation: Located in `src/app/views.py`, the `index` function is defined at line 10 and is mapped to the root URL (`/`).
When a user accesses the root path, this function is triggered, which in turn calls `flask.render_template` to render the `index.html` template.
response.hook: The `index` function serves as the main entry point for the application.
response.next_click: Explore the `index.html` template to understand what content is rendered.
response.pitfall: Ensure that the `index.html` template exists in the templates directory; otherwise, a rendering error will occur.
response.title: Entry Point of the Application
response.why_it_matters: This function is crucial as it initializes the user experience by providing the first view of the application.
